elements.title: Ludwig Krug (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in Ludwig Krug's rendition of Adam and Eve (pictured), an ape mimics Adam eating the apple?

elements.title: Australia's most threatened butterfly (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Australia's most threatened butterfly is confined to a native range of less than 10 square kilometres (3.9 sq mi)?

elements.title: Gordon Cooper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that football player Gordon Cooper performed so well that "the adjective supply [was] exhausted" in trying to describe him?

elements.title: Setsuyaku Rock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the live-action drama adaptation of the Japanese manga Setsuyaku Rock was reimagined as a buddy comedy?

elements.title: Emily Spreeman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Emily Spreeman, the all-time top scorer for the United States women's national deaf soccer team, debuted for the team at the age of 15?

elements.title: San Diego YMCA (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the San Diego YMCA estimates that it has served more than 125 million military personnel?

elements.title: Mindustry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the real-time strategy, tower defense and factory management game Mindustry is freely licensed under the GPLv3?

elements.title: Oen Boen Ing (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Oen Boen Ing, a doctor who often worked for free, was so popular that the Indonesian government was petitioned not to evacuate him during a period of violence against Chinese Indonesians?

elements.title: Infested (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 200 spiders were on the set of Infested?
